core.utils

Class LazyMatrix<X>

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.utils.LazyMatrix<X>
  • Type Parameters:
    X - the generic type of this matrix
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Matrix<X>

    public class LazyMatrix<X>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Matrix<X>
    A matrix that keeps record of every position edited while returns a default value for the others.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LazyMatrix(int width, int height, X base)
      Creates a matrix from a base that is returned for every get call, except for edited positions, which are kept in a list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Eclipse generated equals based on fields.
      X get(int row, int column)
      Checks if that position was ever edited and if not returns base, otherwise returns the saved last edit.

      Returns saved value of heigth.
      int getWidth()
      Returns saved value of width.
      int hashCode()
      Eclipse generated hashCode base don fields.
      <Y> Matrix<Y> map(java.util.function.Function<? super X,? extends Y> mapper)
      Applies the mapper to the base and every edit done, in order to replicate them.
      void rotateClockwise(int times)
      Rotates the matrix by doing transposition and reversing rows.
      void set(int row, int column, X value)
      Adds the value to the edit list, which will be used before the base in the get method.
      java.util.stream.Stream<X> stream()
      Iterates the matrix calling get(int, int) to get each element.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints all the fields.

        height - the height of the matrix
        base - the base (initial value) for each cell
